Title: Lead Marketing Analyst
Description:
SUMMARY:

GEICO’s Marketing Department is seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic individual to join the Marketing Digital Analytics team. We are looking to hire an experienced Lead Marketing Analyst who will play a key role in informing advertising decisions for GEICO’s brand. Responsibilities include leading analytics projects, producing data-driven insights independently, and developing innovative ideas. You will analyze marketing programs and results, use predictive analytics and machine learning to create value from data, and drive strategic analytics initiatives forward. We celebrate diversity and value new perspectives; applicants of all backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.

The Sr. Lead Marketing Analyst must be able to transform large datasets from complex systems to produce actionable insights and present the results to stakeholders at all levels within the company. Candidates will need to successfully manage projects and partner with Marketing, Product, Data Science, and other teams.

This role will be involved in several initiatives including customer acquisition cost optimization, media mix modeling, and the development of marketing business intelligence tools. These initiatives will provide enhanced visibility into key business performance metrics to marketing leadership and business stakeholders.

RESPONSIBILITES:

Analyzing the performance of marketing efforts across multiple channels, including but not limited to Television, Search, Social, Email, and Display/Video advertising. Study user behaviors and work with other analysts to join different data sources for measurement & attribution. Assist with managing and improving processes for identity resolution, tagging, and other tracking parameters. A successful candidate should be comfortable working independently and look to find ways to collaborate with other team members. While analytical skills are crucial for the position, it is just as important to have the ability to communicate and summarize complex information into management ready briefs and presentations. 

REQUIREMENTS:

A 4-year college degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Analytics, Data Science, etc.)3-5 years of experience working with marketing analytics tools and data sources. (Web/App measurement tools, cloud environments, and audience management tools)Experience working with Snowflake and LiveRampExperience in querying large datasets. Strong experience with open-source statistical programming tools (Python/R) for analysis and data visualization. Experience with applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc. Experience working in cloud environments. (Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure)Experience with data visualization tools. (Power BI strongly preferred)Familiar with key marketing KPI’s and CRM management. Knowledgeable of current measurement landscape and identity resolution techniques. 

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science or related technical field. Advanced marketing analytics experience working at a brand or agency. Strong familiarity with Marketing KPI’s to manage optimal marketing investment. Experience with the development and usage of in-house attribution and media mix models. Experience with either 3rd party or in-house data pipeline tools to automate pulling marketing data from various platforms and APIs. 

LOCATION:

Hybrid - 3 days/week from a GEICO office

Annual Salary

$80,000.00 - $154,000.00

The above annual salary range is a general guideline. Multiple factors are taken into consideration to arrive at the final hourly rate/ annual salary to be offered to the selected candidate. Factors include, but are not limited to, the scope and responsibilities of the role, the selected candidate’s work experience, education and training, the work location as well as market and business considerations.

At this time, GEICO will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.

As an Associate, you’ll enjoy our Total Rewards Program* to help secure your financial future and preserve your health and well-being, including:

Title: BISStern - Marketing Analyst
Description:
Overview

BISSELL is seeking a curious and analytical Digital Marketing intern to assist our Email, Personalization and Retention team with database support, measurement, reporting, and research. This person must have a passion for forming conclusions based on their discovery, learning, and connecting dots between events and behavior. This is an exciting opportunity to get real experience understanding the business impact of digital marketing tactics, technology, and Lifetime Value. This person will report to the Associate Director of eCommerce and Digital Marketing.

Responsibilities

As an intern with BISSELL you’ll focus on assignment that can include—

 Create, optimize and manage consumer segments for campaign activation and personalization  Analyze consumer data and identify behavior patterns for new cross- and up-sell opportunities  Develop a view of consumer profile based on their category purchases and mine for insights that can tell us who our consumer is.  Perform analysis on purchase patterns that can identify opportunities to optimize lifetime value. Report out LTV according to acquisition channels, first-purchases, etc.  Analyze patterns of subscriber / consumer churn and identify opportunities to improve retention rates.  Coordinate and monitor the maintenance and integrity of first party data within consumer profiles.  Participate in analysis, research and recommendation for new database technology  Perform other duties as assigned. 

Qualifications

  why   BISSELL?  

Students at BISSELL enjoy the ability to work for a global organization (North America’s leading Floorcare brand) cross-collaboratively across several business functions. Our interns and co-ops sit elbow-to-elbow with organizational leadership, allowing exposure that enhances what’s learned in the classroom. We have a dedication to the business (we work hard!) but we also know how to have fun too.

 position  requirements 

Applicants MUST be currently enrolled at an accredited, four-year university majoring in communications, marketing, or analytics. Eligible candidates must be on track to graduate in either December of 2024 or Spring of 2025.

 Demonstrated strong knowledge or interest of digital systems and marketing programs  Strong social skills or passion for data interpretation capabilities; able to translate findings into insights  Proficiency in business software products such as Excel, Word, PowerPoint  Ability to solve problems quickly and think critically and creatively  Strong analytical, data analysis, and reporting skills  Experience or desire to learn Website Analytics (CDP, GoogleUA360 and GA4)

Title: Marketing Science Analyst (Hiring for April 2024)
Description:
Analytic Partners Recognized as a Leader by The Forrester Wave, Marketing Measurement & Optimization, Q3 2023 Report “Analytic Partners dominates with data-driven marketing insights.”

We are the Commercial Intelligence industry leader and the first to do it! We help brands use data to drive business growth, and we do this using a combination of technology and expert guidance that helps companies make the best possible decisions. Our Commercial Decision Platform GPS-Enterprise is the machine that turns data into actionable insights and our ROI Genome is our proprietary intelligence layer comprised of 20+ years of Analysis, Insights, and Learning. We measure the impact of Product, Sales, Operations, Customer Data and outside factors such as competitors, economic changes, seasonality, consumer mobility, and more to deliver impact. Our customers drive business growth by leveraging our technology and expert analyst!

We’re growing fast, with global operations across our full-service offices in New York City, Miami, Broomfield, Charlottesville, Dallas, Dublin, London, Paris, Hamburg, Munich, Sydney, Melbourne, Singapore, and Shanghai.

What You’ll Be Doing

Collect and analyze data related to consumer behavior, market trends, and campaign performance. Using proprietary tools and techniques to prep, mine and format customer data, analyze, produce models to develop insight dashboards and customer presentations.Develop and maintain statistical models that predict consumer behavior, campaign performance, and other key metrics. Collaborate as part of a team to drive analyses and insights, walking customers through dashboards and developing narratives that explain results and aid in more informed decisions and improved business performance.

What We Look For In You

Bachelor’s degree or above (ideal areas of study: Business Analytics and Management, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, and/or Marketing)Recent graduates and those with 1-3 years of internship or professional work experience across any combination of advanced and predictive analytics, marketing analytics, and analytic techniques for marketing, customer, and business applications. Strong working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint and ExcelYou demonstrate analytical principles, strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Experience working independently on analytical tasks, building, and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures, and data sets.Comfortable working with a team developing and presenting presentations using insights derived from analytics.Experience using data to solve business questions and drive business solutions.You bring strong written and verbal communication appropriate for a professional work environment.

Our Leadership Values For Marketing Science Analysts and Company Culture:

Results Driven Anticipates roadblocks and appropriately seeks assistance to plan around them.Effective Communication Considers the audience and communicates appropriately.Accountability & Integrity Actively looks to offer ways to contribute during downtime.Creative Collaboration Builds relationships with team and contributes regularly.Harnessing Innovation Seeks opportunities to try out new approaches.

Our differentiator is – Our People! We hire the brightest talent and develop them into leaders. We foster a culture of PEOPLE, PASSION and GROWTH.

People: We value our people, customers, and partners

Passion: We love what we do

Growth: Unlimited growth means unlimited potential

AP is a customer-focused, team-oriented organization where innovation and results are rewarded, and individuals can chart the course of their own careers.

As a woman founded and led company, this has meant supporting a meritocracy where everyone has opportunities to achieve their best and ensure we foster an environment of diversity, equity, and inclusion. In practice this means we will not only work to recruit a diverse workforce, but also maximize the full potential of all of our people. You can read more about our commitment to DEI here

Additionally, Analytic Partners participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.

Country Specific Benefits

We provide comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401k matching, commuter benefits, gym membership reimbursement, open PTO, and company paid holidays.

Title: Senior Analyst, Social Media Marketing
Description:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.

When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the microphone and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.

Senior Analyst, Social Media Marketing

Why We Have This Role

This role is key to sharing our Qualtrics story, our values and our mission of ‘making business more human’ to a global audience. The focus will be on organic social engagement with a range of responsibilities aimed at building brand awareness, fostering our XM community engagement and driving organic growth through our social media channels.

How You’ll Find Success

This role requires a truly collaborative networker who can span our global company, inspire creativity, have analytical prowess, a relationship builder and have technical knowledge to effectively manage an organic social content calendar that drives engagement on our platforms. Skills that you will utilize in the role: 

Content Strategy:Develop and implement a comprehensive organic social media content strategy and calendar aligned with Qualtrics goals and values.Create engaging and shareable content that highlights the features and benefits of Qualtrics and the XM community.Foster and engage with the online community around Qualtrics and XM.Respond to comments, messages, and mentions on social media platforms to build relationships.Platform Management:Manage and optimize social media profiles on platforms such as LinkedIn, X, Facebook, and Instagram.Stay informed about platform updates and trends to adapt the strategy accordingly.Audience Research:Conduct audience research to understand the target demographic and tailor content to their preferences.Monitor and report on industry trends and competitor activities to stay ahead in the social media landscape.Analytics and Reporting:Use analytics tools to measure the performance of organic social media efforts.Provide regular reports on key metrics, insights, and recommendations for improvement.Collaboration:Work closely with the wider communications and marketing team, content creators, events teams, localisation and other relevant departments to ensure a cohesive and integrated approach.Collaborate with influencers, if applicable, to extend reach and credibility.Campaign Execution:Plan and execute organic social media campaigns to promote events such as X4, key product launches and other key initiatives.Leverage user-generated content to enhance the authenticity of the brand.Brand Advocacy:Identify and nurture brand advocates within the XM community.Encourage user-generated content and testimonials to build credibility.Stay Updated on Industry Trends:Stay informed about the latest trends and changes in social media algorithms and adjust strategies accordingly.Testing and Optimization:Conduct A/B testing of different content types and posting schedules to optimize organic reach and engagement.
How You’ll Grow

Mastery of Skill Set: We aim to develop the best talent in tech and drive to continuously learn new skills and platforms, such as mastering emerging ad technologies or getting certified in advanced features of existing platforms.Data-Driven Decisions: Enhancing your ability to make data-driven decisions by deepening your understanding of analytics, learning to interpret complex data sets, and staying up to date of the latest tools for data interpretation.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Seeking opportunities to collaborate globally with other departments, like sales development, content, field marketing, localization and product teams, to gain a more holistic view of the business strategy and understand how paid media fits into the larger picture.Industry Engagement: Attending webinars, workshops, and conferences to stay current with industry trends and network with peers. Test new ideas and strategies in your campaigns.Leadership Skills: We encourage leadership and taking the lead irrespective of your level at Qualtrics. You will have the opportunity to lead a cross functional pod, mentoring other team members, leading campaign strategies, or in the future managing a team.

Things You’ll Do

Develop and implement a global content and publishing strategy and calendarWork with communications team to align on publishing schedule and key communications messaging across a shared calendar.Prepare a plan for maximising coverage at X4 and recruit staff members to gather and curate content on your behalf.Approach organic social from a growth mindset, holding the strategy with a growth view in mind globally.Partnering with regional translators and reviewers to publish content that is contextually relevant to our regions.

What We’re Looking For On Your Resume

2-3 years hands on Social Media management experience at agency or client side brand.Demonstrated experience in managing social media accounts for businesses, preferably in the SAAS or tech industry.Proficiency in using social media management tools for scheduling, analytics, and reporting.A strategic mindset with the ability to align social media efforts with overall business goals.Experience developing and executing social media campaigns that contribute to business objectives.A relevant degree in marketing, communications, digital media, or a related field.Demonstrated ability to address challenges and solve problems related to social media engagement and community management.Ability to manage multiple social media accounts and campaigns simultaneously, demonstrating strong organizational skills.

What You Should Know About This Team

Our team is truly global and made up of a hugely talented, fun and collaborative group. We are based across the global spanning locations such as Dublin, Tokyo, Sydney, Utah and Buenos Aires. In this role you will be supported and coached to make an impact!

Our Team’s Favorite Perks And Benefits

Focus Fridays - no meetings!Regular team bonding, including monthly happy hoursSkip level and peer coachingPersonalized training and development plans

For the rest of the week, work where you want, owning the integration of work and life.

Title: Marketing Research Analyst - Fistula Fix
Description:
Position Overview

The KU School of Business and Management and Entrepreneurship Area has coordinated with Fistula Fix to provide a business student internship opportunity as a Market Research Analyst.

The Market Research Analyst will gain hands-on experience in market research, estimating market size, creating financial projections, and delivering a comprehensive presentation. The position will contribute to strategic decision-making processes by providing valuable insights into market trends, potential opportunities, and financial viability. This will be an iterative process where additional work may be suited based on initial findings.

This is a part-time position, up to 10 hours per week, until a minimum of 120 hours is achieved. This position will start late March and continue until the end of the Fall 2024 semester. Due to the collaborative position, the Market Research Analyst position will be remote and will report to both the Director of Entrepreneurship Co-Curricular Programs at the University of Kansas School of Business and the Entrepreneur in Residence at KU Medical Center. This position is contingent on funding.

Fistula Fix, an early-stage start-up company, is creating next-generation speculum used in women's exams for pelvic health, pregnancy, and diagnosing cervical cancer.

Job Description

The Market Research Analyst position will (a) conduct market research, (b) determine estimated market size, (c) develop financial projections, (d) prepare a presentation, and (e) deliver a final presentation.

Duties include, but are not limited to:

Market Research

Conduct primary and secondary research to gather information on industry trends, customer preferences, and competitor analysis.Utilize online databases, industry reports, surveys, and interviews to collect data.Analyze market trends, customer demographics, and purchasing behaviors.Document findings and present preliminary insights to the team for feedback.


Market Size

Apply acquired knowledge to estimate the total addressable market (TAM) and serviceable available market (SAM).Utilize various methodologies such as bottom-up and top-down.Validate assumptions and refine market size estimates based on feedback and additional research.Prepare a comprehensive report outlining the methodology used and the final market size estimates.


Financial Projections

Develop financial models to forecast revenue, expenses, and investment needs.Incorporate market research findings and market size estimates into the financial projections.Present the financial projections to stakeholders and solicit feedback for refinement.


Presentation Preparation

Synthesize research findings, market analysis, and financial projections into a compelling narrative.Create a visually engaging presentation using PowerPoint or other presentation tools.Practice delivery of the presentation to enhance communication and presentation skills.Solicit feedback from mentors and peers to refine the presentation content and delivery.


Final Presentation and Wrap-Up

Deliver the final presentation to key stakeholders, including the Innovator Team and Digital Health Co/Lab.Articulate key findings, insights, and recommendations based on the research and analysis conducted.Address questions and engage in discussions to clarify any aspects of the presentation.Reflect on the internship experience, lessons learned, and areas for future growth.Prepare a comprehensive report summarizing the internship activities, achievements, and recommendations for the company's future strategies.


Required Qualifications

Must be a KU student enrolled in at least 6 credit hours (during spring and fall semesters).Demonstrated evidence of coachability, time management, and/or self-leaderships skills based on application materials.Demonstrated evidence of creativity, based on application materials.Evidence of strong communication skills.


During the semester term of the appointment, the KU student hourly must be enrolled in no fewer than 6 credit hours. For summer periods the student hourly must: 1) have been enrolled in no less than 6 hours in the past spring semester or 2) be pre-enrolled in upcoming fall semester in no less than 6 hours or 3) be enrolled in summer session or 4) be admitted to study in the upcoming fall semester. Experience with Excel spreadsheets.
